alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Marion; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 11:21PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Walker, southeastern Marion and Fayette Counties through MIDNIGHT CST... At 1120 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Belk, or near Fayette, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Carbon Hill, Berry, Glen Allen, Kansas, Belk, Eldridge, Bankston, Bluff, Bazemore, Wayside, Richard Arthur Field, West Corona, Fayette County Public Lake, Bevill State College Fayette, Hubbertville, Fowlers Crossroads, Texas and Corona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
